business.headline: Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. Disney confirms Coco sequel for 2029 with original director returningDisney has officially announced a sequel to its acclaimed animated film Coco. The film, set for release in 2029, is currently in early development stages.

Big B, Salman Khan, Vicky Kaushal to attend tuberculosis awareness cricket matchAmitabh Bachchan, Salman Khan, Vicky Kaushal among other stars are expected to attend TB Mukt Bharat Awareness cricket match which is scheduled to take place on March 22 in Mumbai.

film's limited screen releases.

He has been in the limelight for his drastic weight-loss transformation.

Court rules in ADOR's favour, halts K-pop group NewJeans' independent activitiesThe Seoul Central District Court has ruled in favour of ADOR, affirming its exclusive management rights over the K-pop group NewJeans. This comes after the group went independent and rebranded themselves as NJZ.

general news.headline: Mapping India's GDB: Survey reveals how states fare in social behaviourIndia might be the fastest-growing economy, but how does it fare on social indicators like civic behaviour, safety, gender attitudes and diversity? A first-of-its-kind survey by India Today across 21 states sheds light on the social progress of the country.

Delhi judge's transfer not linked to cash probe: Supreme Court rejects rumoursThe Supreme Court clarified today that Justice Yashwant Varma's transfer to the Allahabad High Court is unrelated to the alleged cash recovery from his residence, emphasising that the in-house inquiry is proceeding separately as per procedure.

DMK hiding behind Hindi row, lacks courage to translate texts in Tamil: Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah accused the DMK government of lacking the courage to introduce Tamil translations for medical and engineering courses, promising to implement them if his party comes to power in the state.

Why Shivaji's grandson went on pilgrimage to Aurangzeb's tombShahu I, the grandson of Shivaji and son of Shambhaji who was executed by the Mughals, visited Aurangzeb's grave. The visit by Shahuji, who was kept captive for 18 years in a Mughal camp, has to be seen in the correct historical and political context, and his battle with Maratha queen Tarabai Bhosle.

But how do its citizens fare when it comes to social responsibilities and civic sense? The India Today Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey for the first time reveals what Indians think about tampering with electric meters or travelling without tickets.

Delhi HC judge with cash stash at home heaped praise on UPIHeaps of cash were found at the official residence of Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma by firefighters who were called to fight a fire. In 2023, Justice Varma heaped praise on UPI, India's indigenous digital transaction interface. UPI is intended to reduce cash transactions, thereby hurting the black economy.

18 protesting BJP MLAs suspended, carried out of Karnataka Assembly by marshalsThe Karnataka Speaker suspended 18 BJP MLAs for six months after they disrupted proceedings over a honey-trap scandal and a bill that gives 4 per cent quota to Muslims in public contracts. BJP members stormed the well, tore documents, and demanded a probe.

IPL Story, Part 3: Greed is good. When Indian cricket met its dark sideCricket has come a long way from its pure, traditional form to its transformation into a commercialised, glamour-driven spectacle through the IPL. The transformation reflects societal and economic shifts in India and the world highlighting IPL's rise as a symbol of materialism, entertainment, and the commodification of both players and fans.

Delhi High Court judge with cash stash at home approved big Income Tax scrutinyNot long ago, one of Justice Varma's notable judgments made headlines after he dismissed the Congress's petition challenging the initiation of tax assessments for the years 2014 to 2017, ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, giving authorities the go-ahead to examine the party's past I-T records.

Did you know that ICSE exam papers were checked in England until 1970s?The ICSE and ISC exam papers were set and corrected in England until the 1970s, decades after independence. The shift to an Indian evaluation system marked a break from colonial control over education.
